intro: Senecio doria subsp. biebersteinii, commonly known as the Doria's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with narrow, succulent leaves that help reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers appear in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
